TGServerService.ServerInstance Class Reference

The class which holds all interface components. There are no safeguards for call race conditions so these must be guarded against internally More...

Inheritance diagram for TGServerService.ServerInstance:
[legend]
Collaboration diagram for TGServerService.ServerInstance:
[legend]

void UpdateToVersionImpl (object param)
 Downloads and unzips a BYOND revision. Calls ApplyStagedUpdate afterwards if the ServerInstance isn't running, otherwise, calls RequestRestart. Sets lastError on failure More...
 
bool UpdateToVersion (int major, int minor)
 updates the used byond version to that of version major .minor . The change won't take place until DD reboots. Calls ITGDreamDaemon.RequestRestart if blocked by a running DD instance. Runs asyncronously, use CurrentStatus to check progress More...

bool Compile (bool silent=false)
 Does all the necessary actions to take the revision currently in the repository and compile it to be run on the next server reboot. Requires BYOND to be set up and the GetStatus to return CompilerStatus.Initialized. Runs asyncronously More...

Detailed Description

The class which holds all interface components. There are no safeguards for call race conditions so these must be guarded against internally

Definition at line 13 of file Administration.cs.

Returns
on success, on failure

Definition at line 314 of file Byond.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.compilerCurrentStatus, TGServerService.ServerInstance.CompilerLock, TGServerService.Program.DeleteDirectory(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.GetVersion(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteError(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo().

315  {
316  lock (CompilerLock)
317  {
318  if (compilerCurrentStatus == CompilerStatus.Compiling)
319  return false;
320  lock (ByondLock)
321  {
322  if (updateStat != ByondStatus.Staged)
323  return false;
324  updateStat = ByondStatus.Updating;
325  }
326  try
327  {
328  var rbd = RelativePath(ByondDirectory);
329  Program.DeleteDirectory(rbd);
330  Directory.Move(RelativePath(StagingDirectoryInner), rbd);
331  Program.DeleteDirectory(RelativePath(StagingDirectory));
332  lastError = null;
333  SendMessage("BYOND: Update completed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
334  WriteInfo(String.Format("BYOND update {0} completed!", GetVersion(ByondVersion.Installed)), EventID.BYONDUpdateComplete);
335  return true;
336  }
337  catch (Exception e)
338  {
339  lastError = e.ToString();
340  SendMessage("BYOND: Update failed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
341  WriteError("BYOND update failed! Error: " + e.ToString(), EventID.BYONDUpdateFail);
342  return false;
343  }
344  finally
345  {
346  lock(ByondLock) {
347  updateStat = ByondStatus.Idle;
348  }
349  }
350  }
351  }

Definition: Byond.cs:18
TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

protected

Parameters

Returns
if the supplied user account may use the requested component, otherwise

Definition at line 113 of file Administration.cs.

References TGServerService.IInstanceConfig.AuthorizedUserGroupSID, TGServerService.ServerInstance.Config, TGServerService.ServerInstance.ServiceSID, and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteAccess().

114  {
115  var contract = operationContext.EndpointDispatcher.ContractName;
116 
117  if (contract == typeof(ITGConnectivity).Name) //always allow connectivity checks
118  return true;
119 
120  var windowsIdent = operationContext.ServiceSecurityContext.WindowsIdentity;
121 
122  if (contract == typeof(ITGInterop).Name)
123  {
124  //only allow the same user the service is running as to use interop, because that's what DD is running as, and don't spam the logs with it unless it fails
125  var result = windowsIdent.User == ServiceSID;
126  if(!result)
127  WriteAccess(windowsIdent.Name, false);
128  return result;
129  }
130 
131  var wp = new WindowsPrincipal(windowsIdent);
132  //first allow admins
133  var authSuccess = wp.IsInRole(WindowsBuiltInRole.Administrator);
134 
135  //if we're not an admin, check that we aren't trying to access the admin interface
136  if (!authSuccess && operationContext.EndpointDispatcher.ContractName != typeof(ITGAdministration).Name && TheDroidsWereLookingFor != null)
137  authSuccess = wp.IsInRole(new SecurityIdentifier(Config.AuthorizedUserGroupSID));
138 
139  lock (authLock)
140  {
141  var user = windowsIdent.Name;
142  if (LastSeenUser != user)
143  {
144  LastSeenUser = user;
145  WriteAccess(user, authSuccess);
146  }
147  }
148  return authSuccess;
149  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.Checkout ( string  sha)

Hard checks out the passed object name

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGRepository.

Definition at line 498 of file Repository.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.DeletePRList(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.Fetch(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.HandleCheckoutProgress(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.LoadRepo(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.ResetNoLock(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateSubmodules(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

499  {
500  if (sha == LiveTrackingBranch)
501  return "I'm sorry Dave, I'm afraid I can't do that...";
502  lock (RepoLock)
503  {
504  var result = LoadRepo();
505  if (result != null)
506  return result;
507  SendMessage("REPO: Checking out object: " + sha, MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
508  try
509  {
510  if (Repo.Branches[sha] == null)
511  {
512  //see if origin has the branch
513  result = Fetch();
514  var trackedBranch = Repo.Branches[String.Format("origin/{0}", sha)];
515  if (trackedBranch != null)
516  {
517  var newBranch = Repo.CreateBranch(sha, trackedBranch.Tip);
518  //track it
519  Repo.Branches.Update(newBranch, b => b.TrackedBranch = trackedBranch.CanonicalName);
520  }
521  else if (result != null)
522  return result;
523  }
524 
525  //if this is a tracked branch, we need to reset to remote first and delete the PR list
526  ResetNoLock(Repo.Head.TrackedBranch ?? Repo.Head);
527  DeletePRList();
528 
529  var Opts = new CheckoutOptions()
530  {
531  CheckoutModifiers = CheckoutModifiers.Force,
532  OnCheckoutProgress = HandleCheckoutProgress,
533  };
534  Commands.Checkout(Repo, sha, Opts);
535  var res = ResetNoLock(null);
536  UpdateSubmodules();
537  SendMessage("REPO: Checkout complete!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
538  WriteInfo("Repo checked out " + sha, EventID.RepoCheckout);
539  return res;
540  }
541  catch (Exception e)
542  {
543  SendMessage("REPO: Checkout failed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
544  WriteWarning(String.Format("Repo checkout of {0} failed: {1}", sha, e.ToString()), EventID.RepoCheckoutFail);
545  return e.ToString();
546  }
547  }
548  }

void TGServerService.ServerInstance.Clone ( object  twostrings)
private

Backups up the StaticDirs and deletes the current RepoPath if they exist. Clones the given branch of the given remote. Sets up new StaticDirs

Parameters

TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

bool TGServerService.ServerInstance.Compile ( bool  silent = false)

Does all the necessary actions to take the revision currently in the repository and compile it to be run on the next server reboot. Requires BYOND to be set up and the GetStatus to return CompilerStatus.Initialized. Runs asyncronously

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGCompiler.

Definition at line 563 of file Compiler.cs.

570  lastCompilerError = null;
571  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Compiling;
572  CompilerThread = new Thread(new ThreadStart(CompileImpl));
573  CompilerThread.Start();
574  }
575  return true;
576  }

288  {
289  try
290  {
291  if (GetVersion(ByondVersion.Installed) == null)
292  {
293  lock (CompilerLock)
294  {
295  lastCompilerError = "BYOND not installed!";
296  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized;
297  return;
298  }
299  }
300  if (!RepoConfigsMatch())
301  {
302  lock (CompilerLock)
303  {
304  lastCompilerError = "Repository TGS3.json does not match cached version! Please update the config appropriately!";
305  compilerCurrentStatus = IsInitialized();
306  return;
307  }
308  }
309  string resurrectee;
310  bool repobusy_check = false;
311  if (!Monitor.TryEnter(RepoLock))
312  repobusy_check = true;
313 
314  if (!repobusy_check)
315  {
316  if (RepoBusy)
317  repobusy_check = true;
318  else
319  RepoBusy = true;
320  Monitor.Exit(RepoLock);
321  }
322 
323  if (repobusy_check)
324  {
325  SendMessage("DM: Copy aborted, repo locked!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
326  lock (CompilerLock)
327  {
328  lastCompilerError = "The repo could not be locked for copying";
329  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized; //still fairly valid
330  return;
331  }
332  }
333  string CurrentSha;
334  try
335  {
336  bool silent;
337  lock (CompilerLock)
338  {
339  silent = silentCompile;
340  silentCompile = false;
341  }
342 
343  if (!silent)
344  SendMessage("DM: Compiling...", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
345 
346  resurrectee = GetStagingDir(); //non-relative
347 
348  var Config = GetCachedRepoConfig();
349  var deleteExcludeList = new List<string> { BridgeDLLName };
350  deleteExcludeList.AddRange(Config.StaticDirectoryPaths);
351  deleteExcludeList.AddRange(Config.DLLPaths);
352  Program.DeleteDirectory(resurrectee, true, deleteExcludeList);
353 
354 
355  Directory.CreateDirectory(resurrectee + "/.git/logs");
356 
357  foreach (var I in Config.StaticDirectoryPaths)
358  {
359  var the_path = Path.Combine(resurrectee, I);
360  if (!Directory.Exists(the_path))
361  CreateSymlink(Path.Combine(resurrectee, I), RelativePath(Path.Combine(StaticDirs, I)));
362  }
363  foreach (var I in Config.DLLPaths)
364  {
365  var the_path = Path.Combine(resurrectee, I);
366  if (!File.Exists(the_path))
367  CreateSymlink(the_path, RelativePath(Path.Combine(StaticDirs, I)));
368  }
369 
370  if (!File.Exists(Path.Combine(resurrectee, BridgeDLLName)))
371  CreateSymlink(Path.Combine(resurrectee, BridgeDLLName), RelativePath(BridgeDLLName));
372 
373  deleteExcludeList.Add(".git");
374  Program.CopyDirectory(RelativePath(RepoPath), resurrectee, deleteExcludeList);
375  CurrentSha = GetHead(false, out string error);
376  //just the tip
377  const string GitLogsDir = "/.git/logs";
378  Program.CopyDirectory(RelativePath(RepoPath + GitLogsDir), resurrectee + GitLogsDir);
379  try
380  {
381  File.Copy(RelativePath(PRJobFile), Path.Combine(resurrectee, PRJobFile));
382  }
383  catch { }
384  }
385  finally
386  {
387  lock (RepoLock)
388  {
389  RepoBusy = false;
390  }
391  }
392 
393  var res = CreateBackup();
394  if (res != null)
395  lock (CompilerLock)
396  {
397  lastCompilerError = res;
398  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized;
399  return;
400  }
401 
402  var dmeName = ProjectName() + ".dme";
403  var dmePath = resurrectee + "/" + dmeName;
404  if (!File.Exists(dmePath))
405  {
406  var errorMsg = String.Format("Could not find {0}!", dmeName);
407  SendMessage("DM: " + errorMsg, MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
408  WriteError(errorMsg, EventID.DMCompileCrash);
409  lock (CompilerLock)
410  {
411  lastCompilerError = errorMsg;
412  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized;
413  return;
414  }
415  }
416 
417  if (!PrecompileHook())
418  {
419  lastCompilerError = "The precompile hook failed";
420  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized; //still fairly valid
421  WriteWarning("Precompile hook failed!", EventID.DMCompileError);
422  return;
423  }
424 
425  using (var DM = new Process()) //will kill the process if the thread is terminated
426  {
427  DM.StartInfo.FileName = RelativePath(ByondDirectory + "/bin/dm.exe");
428  DM.StartInfo.Arguments = String.Format("-clean {0}", dmePath);
429  DM.StartInfo.RedirectStandardOutput = true;
430  DM.StartInfo.UseShellExecute = false;
431  var OutputList = new StringBuilder();
432  DM.OutputDataReceived += new DataReceivedEventHandler(
433  delegate (object sender, DataReceivedEventArgs e)
434  {
435  OutputList.Append(Environment.NewLine);
436  OutputList.Append(e.Data);
437  }
438  );
439  try
440  {
441  lock (CompilerLock)
442  {
443  if (compilationCancellationRequestation)
444  return;
445  canCancelCompilation = true;
446  }
447 
448  DM.Start();
449  DM.BeginOutputReadLine();
450  while (!DM.HasExited)
451  DM.WaitForExit(100);
452  DM.CancelOutputRead();
453 
454  lock (CompilerLock)
455  {
456  canCancelCompilation = false;
457  compilationCancellationRequestation = false;
458  }
459  }
460  catch
461  {
462  if (!DM.HasExited)
463  {
464  DM.Kill();
465  DM.WaitForExit();
466  }
467  throw;
468  }
469  finally
470  {
471  lock (CompilerLock)
472  {
473  canCancelCompilation = false;
474  }
475  }
476 
477  if (DM.ExitCode == 0)
478  {
479  lock (watchdogLock)
480  {
481  //gotta go fast
482  var online = currentStatus == DreamDaemonStatus.Online;
483  if (online)
484  Proc.Suspend();
485  try
486  {
487  var rgdl = RelativePath(GameDirLive);
488  if (Directory.Exists(rgdl))
489  //these next two lines should be atomic but this is the best we can do
490  Directory.Delete(rgdl);
491  CreateSymlink(rgdl, resurrectee);
492  }
493  finally
494  {
495  if (online && !Proc.HasExited)
496  Proc.Resume();
497  }
498  }
499  var staged = DaemonStatus() != DreamDaemonStatus.Offline;
500  if (!PostcompileHook())
501  {
502  lastCompilerError = "The postcompile hook failed";
503  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized; //still fairly valid
504  WriteWarning("Postcompile hook failed!", EventID.DMCompileError);
505  return;
506  }
507  UpdateLiveSha(CurrentSha);
508  var msg = String.Format("Compile complete!{0}", !staged ? "" : " Server will update next round.");
509  SendMessage("DM: " + msg, MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
510  WriteInfo(msg, EventID.DMCompileSuccess);
511  lock (CompilerLock)
512  {
513  if (staged)
514  UpdateStaged = true;
515  lastCompilerError = null;
516  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized; //still fairly valid
517  }
518  }
519  else
520  {
521  SendMessage("DM: Compile failed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo); //Also happens for warnings
522  WriteWarning("Compile error: " + OutputList.ToString(), EventID.DMCompileError);
523  lock (CompilerLock)
524  {
525  lastCompilerError = "DM compile failure";
526  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized;
527  }
528  }
529  }
530 
531  }
532  catch (ThreadAbortException)
533  {
534  return;
535  }
536  catch (Exception e)
537  {
538  SendMessage("DM: Compiler thread crashed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
539  WriteError("Compile manager errror: " + e.ToString(), EventID.DMCompileCrash);
540  lock (CompilerLock)
541  {
542  lastCompilerError = e.ToString();
543  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized; //still fairly valid
544  }
545  }
546  finally
547  {
548  lock (CompilerLock)
549  {
550  canCancelCompilation = false;
551  if (compilationCancellationRequestation)
552  {
553  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initialized;
554  compilationCancellationRequestation = false;
555  SendMessage("DM: Compile cancelled!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
556  WriteInfo("Compilation cancelled", EventID.DMCompileCancel);
557  }
558  }
559  }
560  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.CreateBackup ( )
private

Creates a date and timestamped tag of the current HEAD

Returns
on success, error message on failure

Definition at line 737 of file Repository.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.LoadRepo(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.CompileImpl().

738  {
739  try
740  {
741  lock (RepoLock)
742  {
743  var res = LoadRepo();
744  if (res != null)
745  return res;
746 
747  //Make sure we don't already have a backup at this commit
748  var HEAD = Repo.Head.Tip.Sha;
749  foreach (var T in Repo.Tags)
750  if (T.Target.Sha == HEAD)
751  return null;
752 
753  var tagName = "TGS-Compile-Backup-" + DateTime.Now.ToString("yyyy-MM-dd--HH.mm.ss");
754  var tag = Repo.ApplyTag(tagName);
755 
756  if (tag != null)
757  {
758  WriteInfo("Repo backup created at tag: " + tagName + " commit: " + HEAD, EventID.RepoBackupTag);
759  return null;
760  }
761  throw new Exception("Tag creation failed!");
762  }
763  }
764  catch (Exception e)
765  {
766  WriteWarning(String.Format("Failed backup tag creation at commit {0}!", Repo.Head.Tip.Sha), EventID.RepoBackupTagFail);
767  return e.ToString();
768  }
769  }
TGServerService.ServerInstance.Repo
Repository Repo
The repository object
Definition: Repository.cs:82
TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.DeleteFile ( string  staticRelativePath,
out bool  unauthorized 
)

Deletes the target static file

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGConfig.

Definition at line 156 of file Config.cs.

References TGServerService.Service.CancelImpersonation(), TGServerService.Program.DeleteDirectory(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.StaticDirs, TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

157  {
158  var path = RelativePath(StaticDirs + '/' + staticRelativePath); //do not use path.combine or it will try and take the root
159  try
160  {
161  lock (configLock)
162  {
163  var di1 = new DirectoryInfo(RelativePath(StaticDirs));
164  var fi = new FileInfo(path);
165  var di2 = new DirectoryInfo(fi.Directory.FullName);
166 
167  var good = false;
168  while (di2 != null)
169  {
170  if (di2.FullName == di1.FullName)
171  {
172  good = true;
173  break;
174  }
175  else di2 = di2.Parent;
176  }
177 
178  if (!good)
179  {
180  unauthorized = false;
181  return "Cannot delete above static directories!";
182  }
183 
184  if (fi.Exists)
185  File.Delete(path);
186  else if (Directory.Exists(path))
187  Program.DeleteDirectory(path);
188  Service.CancelImpersonation();
189  WriteInfo("Delete of " + path, EventID.StaticDelete);
190  unauthorized = false;
191  return null;
192  }
193  }
194  catch (UnauthorizedAccessException e)
195  {
196  //no need for the full stacktrace
197  unauthorized = true;
198  return e.Message;
199  }
200  catch (Exception e)
201  {
202  unauthorized = false;
203  Service.CancelImpersonation();
204  WriteWarning(String.Format("Delete of {0} failed! Error: {1}", path, e.ToString()), EventID.StaticRead);
205  return e.ToString();
206  }
207  }

Either let go of Proc for reattachment or terminate it, depending on InstanceConfig.ReattachRequired of Config

Definition at line 160 of file DreamDaemon.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.Config, TGServerService.ServerInstance.DaemonStatus(), TGServerService.IInstanceConfig.ReattachRequired, TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.Stop(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WorldAnnounce(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteCurrentDDLog().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.RunDisposals().

161  {
162  var Detach = Config.ReattachRequired;
163  bool RenameLog = false;
164  if (DaemonStatus() == DreamDaemonStatus.Online)
165  {
166  if (!Detach)
167  {
168  WorldAnnounce("Server service stopped");
169  Thread.Sleep(1000);
170  }
171  else
172  {
173  RenameLog = CurrentDDLog != null;
174  SendMessage("DD: Detaching watch dog for update!", MessageType.WatchdogInfo);
175  WriteCurrentDDLog("Service updating! Splitting diagnostics...");
176  }
177  }
178  else if (Detach)
179  Config.ReattachRequired = false;
180  Stop();
181  if (pcpu != null)
182  pcpu.Dispose();
183  if (RenameLog)
184  try
185  {
186  var rrdd = RelativePath(ResourceDiagnosticsDir);
187  File.Move(Path.Combine(rrdd, CurrentDDLog), Path.Combine(rrdd, "SU-" + CurrentDDLog));
188  }
189  catch { }
190  }

void TGServerService.ServerInstance.GenCommsKey ( )
private

Definition at line 240 of file Interop.cs.

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.StartImpl().

241  {
242  var charsToRemove = new string[] { "!", "@", "#", "$", "%", "^", "&", "*", "(", ")", "_", "-", "+", "=", "[", "{", "]", "}", ";", ":", "<", ">", "|", ".", "/", "?" };
243  serviceCommsKey = String.Empty;
244  do {
245  var tmp = Membership.GeneratePassword(CommsKeyLen, 0);
246  foreach (var c in charsToRemove)
247  tmp = tmp.Replace(c, String.Empty);
248  serviceCommsKey += tmp;
249  } while (serviceCommsKey.Length < CommsKeyLen);
250  serviceCommsKey = serviceCommsKey.Substring(0, CommsKeyLen);
251  WriteInfo("Service Comms Key set to: " + serviceCommsKey, EventID.CommsKeySet);
252  }
TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

string serviceCommsKey

1290  return result;
1291  }

1293

1295  foreach(var I in RConfig.PipDependancies)
1296  using (var pip = new Process())
1297  {
1298  pip.StartInfo.FileName = PipFile;
1299  pip.StartInfo.Arguments = "install " + I;
1300  pip.StartInfo.UseShellExecute = false;
1301  pip.StartInfo.RedirectStandardOutput = true;
1302  pip.Start();
1303  using (StreamReader reader = pip.StandardOutput)
1304  {
1305  result += "\r\n---BEGIN-PIP-OUTPUT---\r\n" + reader.ReadToEnd();

1307  pip.WaitForExit();

1309  {
1310  error = "Script and pip failed!";

254  }
255 
256  //So TheDir is what the Live folder is NOT pointing to
257  //Now we need to check if DD is running that folder and swap it if necessary
258 
259  var rsclock = RelativePath(TheDir + "/" + Config.ProjectName + ".rsc.lk");
260  if (File.Exists(rsclock))
261  {
262  try
263  {
264  File.Delete(rsclock);
265  }
266  catch //held open by byond
267  {
268  //This means there is a staged update waiting to be applied, we have to unstage it before we can work
269  Directory.Delete(RelativePath(GameDirLive));
270  CreateSymlink(RelativePath(GameDirLive), TheDir);
271  return RelativePath(InvertDirectory(TheDir));
272  }
273  }
274  return RelativePath(TheDir);
275  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.GetVersion ( ByondVersion  type)

Get the currently installed version as a string formatted as Major.Minor

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGByond.

Definition at line 149 of file Byond.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.VersionFile.

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.ApplyStagedUpdate(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.CanStart(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.CompileImpl().

150  {
151  try
152  {
153  lock (ByondLock)
154  {
155  if (type == ByondVersion.Latest)
156  {
157  //get the latest version from the website
158  HttpWebRequest request = (HttpWebRequest)WebRequest.Create(ByondLatestURL);
159  var results = new List<string>();
160  using (HttpWebResponse response = (HttpWebResponse)request.GetResponse())
161  {
162  using (StreamReader reader = new StreamReader(response.GetResponseStream()))
163  {
164  string html = reader.ReadToEnd();
165 
166  Regex regex = new Regex("\\\"([^\"]*)\\\"");
167  MatchCollection matches = regex.Matches(html);
168  foreach (Match match in matches)
169  if (match.Success && match.Value.Contains("_byond.exe"))
170  results.Add(match.Value.Replace("\"", "").Replace("_byond.exe", ""));
171  }
172  }
173  results.Sort();
174  results.Reverse();
175  return results.Count > 0 ? results[0] : null;
176  }
177  else
178  {
179  string DirToUse = RelativePath(type == ByondVersion.Staged ? StagingDirectoryInner : ByondDirectory);
180  if (Directory.Exists(DirToUse))
181  {
182  string file = DirToUse + VersionFile;
183  if (File.Exists(file))
184  return File.ReadAllText(file);
185  }
186  }
187  return null;
188  }
189  }
190  catch (Exception e)
191  {
192  return "Error: " + e.ToString();
193  }
194  }

void TGServerService.ServerInstance.HandleCommand ( string  cmd)
private

86  {
87  var splits = new List<string>(cmd.Split(' '));
88  cmd = splits[0];
89  splits.RemoveAt(0);
90 
91  bool APIValid;
92  lock (topicLock)
93  {
94  APIValid = CheckAPIVersionConstraints();
95  }
96 
97  if (!APIValid && cmd != SRAPIVersion)
98  return; //SPEAK THE LANGUAGE!!!
99 
100  switch (cmd)
101  {
102  case SRIRCBroadcast:
103  SendMessage("GAME: " + String.Join(" ", splits), MessageType.GameInfo);
104  break;
105  case SRKillProcess:
106  KillMe();
107  break;
108  case SRIRCAdminChannelMessage:
109  SendMessage("RELAY: " + String.Join(" ", splits), MessageType.AdminInfo);
110  break;
111  case SRWorldReboot:
112  WriteInfo("World Rebooted", EventID.WorldReboot);
113  WriteCurrentDDLog("World rebooted");
114  ServerChatCommands = null;
115  ChatConnectivityCheck();
116  lock (CompilerLock)
117  {
118  if (UpdateStaged)
119  {
120  UpdateStaged = false;
121  lock (topicLock)
122  {
123  GameAPIVersion = null; //needs updating
124  }
125  WriteInfo("Staged update applied", EventID.ServerUpdateApplied);
126  }
127  }
128  break;
129  case SRAPIVersion:
130  lock (topicLock)
131  {
132  try
133  {
134  GameAPIVersion = new Version(splits[0]);
135  if (!CheckAPIVersionConstraints())
136  throw new Exception();
137  }
138  catch
139  {
140  WriteWarning(String.Format("API version of the game ({0}) is incompatible with the current supported API versions (3.{2}.x.x). Interop disabled.", splits.Count > 1 ? splits[1] : "NULL", AllowedMajorAPIVersion), EventID.APIVersionMismatch);
141  GameAPIVersion = null;
142  break;
143  }
144  }
145  //This needs to be done asyncronously otherwise DD won't be able to process it, because it's waiting for THIS THREAD to return
146  ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(_ => SendCommand(SCAPICompat));
147  break;
148  }
149  }

TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

bool TGServerService.ServerInstance.HandleEvent ( string  eventName)
private

Runs an event named eventName if it exists

Parameters

Returns
if the event handler exists and failed to run, otherwise

Definition at line 48 of file PreactionHandler.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.EventHandlerExists(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.GetEventPath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.PostcompileHook(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.PrecompileHook().

49  {
50 
51  if (!EventHandlerExists(eventName))
52  {
53  // We don't need a handler, so let's just fail silently.
54  return true;
55  }
56 
57  var process = new Process
58  {
59  StartInfo = new ProcessStartInfo
60  {
61  FileName = GetEventPath(eventName),
62  UseShellExecute = false,
63  RedirectStandardOutput = true,
64  RedirectStandardError = true,
65  CreateNoWindow = true
66  }
67  };
68  process.Start();
69  process.WaitForExit();
70 
71  var stdout = process.StandardOutput.ReadToEnd();
72  var stderr = process.StandardError.ReadToEnd();
73  var success = process.ExitCode == 0;
74  var eventData = String.Format("Preaction Event: {0} @ {1} ran. Stdout:\n{2}\nStderr:\n{3}", eventName, GetEventPath(eventName), stdout, stderr);
75 
76  if (success)
77  WriteInfo(eventData, EventID.PreactionEvent);
78  else
79  WriteWarning(eventData, EventID.PreactionFail);
80 
81  return success;
82  }

98  {
99  Directory.CreateDirectory(RelativePath(DiagnosticsDir));
100  Directory.CreateDirectory(RelativePath(ResourceDiagnosticsDir));
101  var Reattach = Config.ReattachRequired;
102  if (Reattach)
103  try
104  {
105  Proc = Process.GetProcessById(Config.ReattachProcessID);
106  if (Proc == null)
107  throw new Exception("GetProcessById returned null!");
108  WriteInfo("Reattached to running DD process!", EventID.DDReattachSuccess);
109  ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(_ =>
110  {
111  Thread.Sleep(5000);
112  SendMessage("DD: Update complete. Watch dog reactivated...", MessageType.WatchdogInfo);
113  });
114 
115  //start wd
116  lock (restartLock)
117  {
118  RestartInProgress = true;
119  ReattachInsteadOfRestart = true;
120  }
121  currentPort = Config.ReattachPort;
122  serviceCommsKey = Config.ReattachCommsKey;
123  try
124  {
125  GameAPIVersion = new Version(Config.ReattachAPIVersion);
126  }
127  catch { }
128  currentStatus = DreamDaemonStatus.Online;
129  DDWatchdog = new Thread(new ThreadStart(Watchdog));
130  DDWatchdog.Start();
131  }
132  catch (Exception e)
133  {
134  WriteError(String.Format("Failed to reattach to DreamDaemon! PID: {0}. Exception: {1}", Config.ReattachProcessID, e.ToString()), EventID.DDReattachFail);
135  }
136  finally
137  {
138  Config.ReattachRequired = false;
139  Config.Save();
140  }
141 
142  if (Proc == null)
143  Proc = new Process();
144 
145  Proc.StartInfo.FileName = RelativePath(ByondDirectory + "/bin/dreamdaemon.exe");
146  Proc.StartInfo.UseShellExecute = false;
147 
148  if (Reattach)
149  return;
150 
151  //autostart the server
152  if (Config.Autostart)
153  //break this off so we don't hold up starting the service
154  ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(_ => { Start(); });
155  }

Definition: Repository.cs:134
TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

bool TGServerService.ServerInstance.Initialize ( )

Sets up the symlinks for hotswapping game code. This will reset everything in the Game folder. Requires the repository to be set up and locks it once the compilation stage starts. Runs asyncronously from this call

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGCompiler.

Definition at line 104 of file Compiler.cs.

106  lock (CompilerLock)

108  if (!CompilerIdleNoLock())
109  return false;
110  lastCompilerError = null;
111  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Initializing;
112  CompilerThread = new Thread(new ThreadStart(InitializeImpl));
113  CompilerThread.Start();
114  return true;
115  }
116  }

145  try
146  {
147  if (DaemonStatus() != DreamDaemonStatus.Offline)
148  {
149  lock (CompilerLock)
150  {
151  lastCompilerError = "Dream daemon must not be running";
152  compilerCurrentStatus = IsInitialized();
153  return;

155  }
156 
157  if (!Exists()) //repo
158  {
159  lock (CompilerLock)
160  {
161  lastCompilerError = "Repository is not setup!";
162  compilerCurrentStatus = IsInitialized();
163  return;
164  }
165  }
166 
167  if (!RepoConfigsMatch())
168  {
169  lock (CompilerLock)
170  {
171  lastCompilerError = "Repository TGS3.json does not match cached version! Please update the config appropriately!";
172  compilerCurrentStatus = IsInitialized();
173  return;
174  }
175  }

186 
187  if (rep_config != null) {
188  foreach (var I in rep_config.StaticDirectoryPaths)
189  CreateSymlink(RelativePath(Path.Combine(GameDirA, I)), RelativePath(Path.Combine(StaticDirs, I)));
190  foreach (var I in rep_config.DLLPaths)
191  CreateSymlink(RelativePath(Path.Combine(GameDirA, I)), RelativePath(Path.Combine(StaticDirs, I)));
192  }
193 
194  var rbdlln = RelativePath(BridgeDLLName);
195  CreateSymlink(RelativePath(Path.Combine(GameDirA, BridgeDLLName)), rbdlln);
196  CreateSymlink(RelativePath(Path.Combine(GameDirB, BridgeDLLName)), rbdlln);
197 
198  CreateSymlink(RelativePath(GameDirLive), RelativePath(GameDirA));
199 
200  lock (CompilerLock)
201  {
202  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Compiling;
203  silentCompile = true;
204  }
205  }
206  catch (ThreadAbortException)
207  {
208  return;
209  }
210  catch (Exception e)
211  {
212  lock (CompilerLock)
213  {
214  SendMessage("DM: Setup failed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
215  WriteError("Compiler Initialization Error: " + e.ToString(), EventID.DMInitializeCrash);
216  lastCompilerError = e.ToString();
217  compilerCurrentStatus = CompilerStatus.Uninitialized;
218  return;
219  }
220  }
221  }
222  catch (ThreadAbortException)
223  {
224  return;
225  }
226  CompileImpl();
227  }

135  {
136  lock (ChatLock)
137  {
138  var rawdata = Config.ChatProviderData;
139  if (rawdata == UninitializedString)
140  return new List<ChatSetupInfo>() { new IRCSetupInfo() { Nickname = Config.Name }, new DiscordSetupInfo() };
141 
142  string plaintext;

144  {
145  plaintext = Helpers.DecryptData(rawdata, Config.ChatProviderEntropy);
146 
147  var lists = new JavaScriptSerializer().Deserialize<List<List<string>>>(plaintext);

149  var foundirc = 0;
150  var founddiscord = 0;
151  foreach (var l in lists)
152  {
153  var info = new ChatSetupInfo(l);
154  if (info.Provider == ChatProvider.Discord)
155  ++founddiscord;
156  else if (info.Provider == ChatProvider.IRC)
157  ++foundirc;
158  output.Add(info);
159  }
160 
161  if (foundirc != 1 || founddiscord != 1)
162  throw new Exception();
163 
164  return output;
165  }
166  catch
167  {
168  Config.ChatProviderData = UninitializedString;
169  }
170  }

173  }

250  {
251  bool DoRestart;
252  lock (watchdogLock)
253  {
254  DoRestart = AwaitingShutdown == ShutdownRequestPhase.None;
255  if (!DoRestart)
256  AwaitingShutdown = ShutdownRequestPhase.Pinged;
257  }
258  //Do this is a seperate thread or we'll kill this thread in the middle of rebooting
259  if (DoRestart)
260  ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem(_ => { Restart(); });

263  }

Definition at line 211 of file Config.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.StaticDirs.

212  {
213  try
214  {
215  if (!Directory.Exists(RelativePath(StaticDirs)))
216  {
217  error = null;
218  unauthorized = false;
219  return new List<string>();
220  }
221  DirectoryInfo dirToEnum = new DirectoryInfo(RelativePath(StaticDirs) + '/' + subDir ?? ""); //do not use path.combine or it will try and take the root
222  var result = new List<string>();
223  foreach (var I in dirToEnum.GetFiles())
224  result.Add(I.Name);
225  foreach (var I in dirToEnum.GetDirectories())
226  result.Add('/' + I.Name);
227  error = null;
228  unauthorized = false;
229  return result;
230  }
231  catch (UnauthorizedAccessException e)
232  {
233  //no need for the full stacktrace
234  error = e.Message;
235  unauthorized = true;
236  return null;
237  }
238  catch (Exception e)
239  {
240  error = e.ToString();
241  unauthorized = false;
242  return null;
243  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.MergePullRequest ( int  PRNumber)

Merges the target pull request into the current branch if the remote is a github repository

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGRepository.

Definition at line 869 of file Repository.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.Config, TGServerService.ServerInstance.GenerateFetchOptions(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.GetCurrentPRList(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.LoadRepo(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.MergeBranch(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.PushTestmergeCommit(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.ResetNoLock(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SetCurrentPRList(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateSubmodules(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteError(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

870  {
871  lock (RepoLock)
872  {
873  var result = LoadRepo();
874  if (result != null)
875  return result;
876  SendMessage(String.Format("REPO: Merging PR #{0}...", PRNumber), MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
877  result = ResetNoLock(null);
878  if (result != null)
879  return result;
880  try
881  {
882  //only supported with github
883  var remoteUrl = Repo.Network.Remotes["origin"].Url;
884  if (!remoteUrl.Contains("github.com"))
885  return "Only supported with Github based repositories.";
886 
887 
888  var Refspec = new List<string>();
889  var PRBranchName = String.Format("pr-{0}", PRNumber);
890  var LocalBranchName = String.Format("pull/{0}/headrefs/heads/{1}", PRNumber, PRBranchName);
891  Refspec.Add(String.Format("pull/{0}/head:{1}", PRNumber, PRBranchName));
892  var logMessage = "";
893 
894  var branch = Repo.Branches[LocalBranchName];
895  if (branch != null)
896  //Need to delete the branch first in case of rebase
897  Repo.Branches.Remove(branch);
898 
899  Commands.Fetch(Repo, "origin", Refspec, GenerateFetchOptions(), logMessage); //shitty api has no failure state for this
900 
901  currentProgress = -1;
902 
903  var Config = Properties.Settings.Default;
904 
905 
906  branch = Repo.Branches[LocalBranchName];
907  if (branch == null)
908  {
909  SendMessage("REPO: PR could not be fetched. Does it exist?", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
910  return String.Format("PR #{0} could not be fetched. Does it exist?", PRNumber);
911  }
912 
913  //so we'll know if this fails
914  var Result = MergeBranch(LocalBranchName, String.Format("Testmerge commit for pull request #{0}", PRNumber));
915 
916  if (Result == null)
917  try
918  {
919  UpdateSubmodules();
920  }
921  catch (Exception e)
922  {
923  Result = e.ToString();
924  }
925 
926  if (Result == null)
927  {
928  WriteInfo(String.Format("Merged pull request #{0}", PRNumber), EventID.RepoPRMerge);
929  try
930  {
931  var CurrentPRs = GetCurrentPRList();
932  var PRNumberString = PRNumber.ToString();
933  CurrentPRs.Remove(PRNumberString);
934  var newPR = new Dictionary<string, string>();
935 
936  //do some excellent remote fuckery here to get the api page
937  var prAPI = remoteUrl;
938  prAPI = prAPI.Replace("/.git", "");
939  prAPI = prAPI.Replace(".git", "");
940  prAPI = prAPI.Replace("github.com", "api.github.com/repos");
941  prAPI += "/pulls/" + PRNumberString + ".json";
942  string json;
943  using (var wc = new WebClient())
944  {
945  wc.Headers.Add("user-agent", "TGStationServerService");
946  json = wc.DownloadString(prAPI);
947  }
948 
949  var Deserializer = new JavaScriptSerializer();
950  var dick = Deserializer.DeserializeObject(json) as IDictionary<string, object>;
951  var user = dick["user"] as IDictionary<string, object>;
952 
953  newPR.Add("commit", branch.Tip.Sha);
954  newPR.Add("author", (string)user["login"]);
955  newPR.Add("title", (string)dick["title"]);
956  CurrentPRs.Add(PRNumberString, newPR);
957  SetCurrentPRList(CurrentPRs);
958  }
959  catch (Exception e)
960  {
961  WriteError("Failed to update PR list", EventID.RepoPRListError);
962  return "PR Merged, JSON update failed: " + e.ToString();
963  }
964 
965  PushTestmergeCommit();
966  }
967  return Result;
968  }
969  catch (Exception E)
970  {
971  SendMessage("REPO: PR merge failed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
972  WriteWarning(String.Format("Failed to merge pull request #{0}: {1}", PRNumber, E.ToString()), EventID.RepoPRMergeFail);
973  return E.ToString();
974  }
975  }
976  }

TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

private

Definition at line 584 of file Repository.cs.

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.MergePullRequest(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateImpl().

585  {
586  if (Config.PushTestmergeCommits && SSHAuth())
587  {
588  string NewB = null;
589  var targetRemote = Repo.Network.Remotes[SSHPushRemote];
590  var options = new PushOptions()
591  {
592  CredentialsProvider = GenerateGitCredentials
593  };
594  try
595  {
596  //now try and push the commit to the remote so they can be referenced
597  NewB = Repo.CreateBranch(RemoteTempBranchName).CanonicalName;
598  Repo.Network.Push(targetRemote, NewB, options); //push the branch
599  Repo.Branches.Remove(NewB);
600  var removalString = String.Format(":{0}", NewB);
601  NewB = null;
602  //we need to delay the second operation a LOT otherwise we get ssh errors
603  Thread.Sleep(10000);
604  Repo.Network.Push(targetRemote, removalString, options); //delete the branch
605  WriteInfo("Pushed reference commit: " + Repo.Head.Tip.Sha, EventID.ReferencePush);
606  }
607  catch (Exception e)
608  {
609  WriteWarning(String.Format("Failed to push reference commit: {0}. Error: {1}", Repo.Head.Tip.Sha, e.ToString()), EventID.ReferencePush);
610  }
611  finally
612  {
613  if (NewB != null)
614  {
615  //Try to delete the branches regardless
616  try
617  {
618  Repo.Branches.Remove(NewB);
619  }
620  catch { }
621  try
622  {
623  Repo.Network.Push(targetRemote, String.Format(":{0}", NewB), options);
624  }
625  catch { }
626  }
627  }
628  }
629  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.ReadText ( string  staticRelativePath,
bool  repo,
out string  error,
out bool  unauthorized 
)

Read from a static file

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGConfig.

Definition at line 19 of file Config.cs.

References TGServerService.Service.CancelImpersonation(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.Config, TGServerService.ServerInstance.GetCachedRepoConfig(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RepoPath, TGServerService.ServerInstance.StaticDirs, TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

20  {
21  string path = null;
22  try
23  {
24  var configDir = RelativePath(repo ? RepoPath : StaticDirs);
25 
26  path = configDir + '/' + staticRelativePath; //do not use path.combine or it will try and take the root
27  lock (configLock)
28  {
29  var di1 = new DirectoryInfo(configDir);
30  if (repo)
31  {
32  //ensure we aren't trying to read anything outside the static dirs
33  var Config = GetCachedRepoConfig();
34  if (Config == null)
35  {
36  error = "Unable to load static directory configuration";
37  unauthorized = false;
38  return null;
39  }
40  var Found = false;
41  foreach (var I in Config.StaticDirectoryPaths)
42  {
43  if (di1.FullName == new DirectoryInfo(Path.Combine(RelativePath(RepoPath), I)).FullName)
44  {
45  Found = true;
46  break;
47  }
48  }
49  if (!Found)
50  {
51  error = "File is not in a configured static directory!";
52  unauthorized = false;
53  return null;
54  }
55  }
56 
57  var di2 = new DirectoryInfo(new FileInfo(path).Directory.FullName);
58 
59  var good = false;
60  while (di2 != null)
61  {
62  if (di2.FullName == di1.FullName)
63  {
64  good = true;
65  break;
66  }
67  else di2 = di2.Parent;
68  }
69 
70  if (!good)
71  {
72  error = "Cannot read above static directories!";
73  unauthorized = false;
74  return null;
75  }
76 
77  var output = File.ReadAllText(path);
78  Service.CancelImpersonation();
79  WriteInfo("Read of " + path, EventID.StaticRead);
80  error = null;
81  unauthorized = false;
82  return output;
83  }
84  }
85  catch (UnauthorizedAccessException e)
86  {
87  //no need for the full stacktrace
88  error = e.Message;
89  unauthorized = true;
90  return null;
91  }
92  catch (Exception e)
93  {
94  error = e.ToString();
95  Service.CancelImpersonation();
96  WriteWarning(String.Format("Read of {0} failed! Error: {1}", path, e.ToString()), EventID.StaticRead);
97  unauthorized = false;
98  return null;
99  }
100  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.Reset ( bool  trackedBranch)

Runs git reset –hard

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGRepository.

Definition at line 801 of file Repository.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.DeletePRList(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.LoadRepo(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.ResetNoLock(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

802  {
803  lock (RepoLock)
804  {
805  var res = LoadRepo() ?? ResetNoLock(trackedBranch ? (Repo.Head.TrackedBranch ?? Repo.Head) : Repo.Head);
806  if (res == null)
807  {
808  SendMessage(String.Format("REPO: Hard reset to {0}branch", trackedBranch ? "tracked " : ""), MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
809  if (trackedBranch)
810  DeletePRList();
811  WriteInfo(String.Format("Repo branch reset{0}", trackedBranch ? " to tracked branch" : ""), trackedBranch ? EventID.RepoResetTracked : EventID.RepoReset);
812  return null;
813  }
814  WriteWarning(String.Format("Failed to reset{0}: {1}", trackedBranch ? " to tracked branch" : "", res), trackedBranch ? EventID.RepoResetTrackedFail : EventID.RepoResetFail);
815  return res;
816  }
817  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.ResetNoLock ( Branch  targetBranch)
private

Equivalent of running git reset --hard on the repository. Requires RepoLock

Parameters
targetBranchIf not , reset to this branch instead of HEAD
Returns

TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendTopic ( string  topicdata,
ushort  port 
)
private

Definition at line 182 of file Interop.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.CheckAPIVersionConstraints().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendCommand().

183  {
184  //santize the escape characters in accordance with http://www.byond.com/docs/ref/info.html#/proc/params2list
185  lock (topicLock) {
186  if (!CheckAPIVersionConstraints())
187  return "Incompatible API!";
188 
189  StringBuilder stringPacket = new StringBuilder();
190  stringPacket.Append((char)'\x00', 8);
191  stringPacket.Append('?' + topicdata);
192  stringPacket.Append((char)'\x00');
193  string fullString = stringPacket.ToString();
194  var packet = Encoding.ASCII.GetBytes(fullString);
195  packet[1] = 0x83;
196  var FinalLength = packet.Length - 4;
197  if (FinalLength > UInt16.MaxValue)
198  return "Error: Topic too long";
199 
200  var lengthBytes = BitConverter.GetBytes((ushort)FinalLength);
201 
202  packet[2] = lengthBytes[1]; //fucking endianess
203  packet[3] = lengthBytes[0];
204 
205  var returnedString = "NULL";
206  var returnedData = new byte[UInt16.MaxValue];
207  using (var topicSender = new Socket(AddressFamily.InterNetwork, SocketType.Stream, ProtocolType.Tcp) { SendTimeout = 5000, ReceiveTimeout = 5000 })
208  try
209  {
210  topicSender.Connect(IPAddress.Loopback, port);
211  topicSender.Send(packet);
212 
213  try
214  {
215  topicSender.Receive(returnedData);
216  var raw_string = Encoding.ASCII.GetString(returnedData).TrimEnd(new char[] { (char)0 }).Trim();
217  if (raw_string.Length > 6)
218  returnedString = raw_string.Substring(5, raw_string.Length - 5).Trim();
219  }
220  catch
221  {
222  returnedString = "Topic recieve error!";
223  }
224  finally
225  {
226  topicSender.Shutdown(SocketShutdown.Both);
227  }
228  }
229  catch
230  {
231  return "Topic delivery failed!";
232  }
233 
234  return returnedString;
235  }
236  }

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.Setup ( string  RepoURL,
string  BranchName 
)

Deletes whatever may be left over and clones the repo at remote and checks out branch . Will move config and data dirs to a backup location if they exist. Runs asyncronously

400  RepoBusy = true;
401  Cloning = true;
402  new Thread(new ParameterizedThreadStart(Clone))
403  {
404  IsBackground = true //make sure we don't hold up shutdown
405  }.Start(RepoURL + ' ' + BranchName);

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.StatusString ( bool  includeMetaInfo)

Returns a human readable string of the current server status

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGDreamDaemon.

Definition at line 672 of file DreamDaemon.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.DaemonStatus(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.SecurityWord().

673  {
674  const string visSecStr = " (Sec: {0})";
675  string res;
676  var ds = DaemonStatus();
677  switch (ds)
678  {
679  case DreamDaemonStatus.Offline:
680  res = "OFFLINE";
681  break;
682  case DreamDaemonStatus.HardRebooting:
683  res = "REBOOTING";
684  break;
685  case DreamDaemonStatus.Online:
686  res = "ONLINE";
687  if (includeMetaInfo)
688  {
689  string secandvis;
690  lock (watchdogLock)
691  {
692  secandvis = String.Format(visSecStr, SecurityWord(true));
693  }
694  res += secandvis;
695  }
696  break;
697  default:
698  res = "NULL AND ERRORS";
699  break;
700  }
701  if (includeMetaInfo && ds != DreamDaemonStatus.Online)
702  res += String.Format(visSecStr, SecurityWord());
703  return res;
704  }

void TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateBridgeDll ( bool  overwrite)
private

Copies BridgeDLLName from the program directory to the the ServerInstance directory

Parameters

Definition at line 525 of file DreamDaemon.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.BridgeDLLName, TGServerService.ServerInstance.DreamDaemonBridgeType, TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteError(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.InitialConfigureRepository(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.InitRepo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.StartImpl().

526  {
527  var rbdlln = RelativePath(BridgeDLLName);
528  var FileExists = File.Exists(rbdlln);
529  if (FileExists && !overwrite)
530  return;
531  //Copy the interface dll to the static dir
532 
533  var InterfacePath = Assembly.GetAssembly(typeof(IInterface)).Location;
534  //bridge is installed next to the interface
535  var BridgePath = Path.Combine(Path.GetDirectoryName(InterfacePath), BridgeDLLName);
536 #if DEBUG
537  //We could be debugging from the project directory
538  if (!File.Exists(BridgePath))
539  //A little hackish debug mode doctoring never hurt anyone
540  BridgePath = Path.Combine(Path.GetDirectoryName(Path.GetDirectoryName(Path.GetDirectoryName(Path.GetDirectoryName(InterfacePath)))), "TGDreamDaemonBridge/bin/x86/Debug", BridgeDLLName);
541 #endif
542  try
543  {
544  //Use reflection to ensure these are the droids we're looking for
545  Assembly.ReflectionOnlyLoadFrom(BridgePath).GetType(DreamDaemonBridgeType, true);
546  }
547  catch (Exception e)
548  {
549  WriteError(String.Format("Unable to locate {0}! Error: {1}", BridgeDLLName, e.ToString()), EventID.BridgeDLLUpdateFail);
550  return;
551  }
552 
553  try
554  {
555  if (FileExists)
556  {
557  var Old = File.ReadAllBytes(rbdlln);
558  var New = File.ReadAllBytes(BridgePath);
559  if (Old.SequenceEqual(New))
560  return; //no need
561  }
562  File.Copy(BridgePath, rbdlln, overwrite);
563  }
564  catch
565  {
566  try
567  {
568  //ok the things being stupid and hasn't released the dll yet, try ONCE more
569  Thread.Sleep(1000);
570  File.Copy(BridgePath, rbdlln, overwrite);
571  }
572  catch (Exception e)
573  {
574  //intentionally using the fi
575  WriteError("Failed to update bridge DLL! Error: " + e.ToString(), EventID.BridgeDLLUpdateFail);
576  return;
577  }
578  }
579  WriteInfo("Updated interface DLL", EventID.BridgeDLLUpdated);
580  }
TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

)
private

Fetches the origin and merges it into the current branch

Parameters

on success, error message on failure

Definition at line 643 of file Repository.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.DeletePRList(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.Fetch(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.LoadRepo(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.LocalIsRemote(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.MergeBranch(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.PushTestmergeCommit(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RepoErrorUpToDate, TGServerService.ServerInstance.ResetNoLock(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateSubmodules(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.AutoUpdateTimer_Elapsed(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.Update().

644  {
645  lock (RepoLock)
646  {
647  var result = LoadRepo();
648  if (result != null)
649  return result;
650  try
651  {
652  if (Repo.Head == null || !Repo.Head.IsTracking)
653  return "Cannot update while not on a tracked branch";
654 
655  var res = Fetch();
656  if (res != null)
657  return res;
658 
659  var originBranch = Repo.Head.TrackedBranch;
660  if (!successOnUpToDate && Repo.Head.Tip.Sha == originBranch.Tip.Sha)
661  return RepoErrorUpToDate;
662 
663  SendMessage(String.Format("REPO: Updating origin branch...({0})", reset ? "Hard Reset" : "Merge"), MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
664 
665  if (reset)
666  {
667  var error = ResetNoLock(Repo.Head.TrackedBranch);
668  UpdateSubmodules();
669  if (error != null)
670  throw new Exception(error);
671  DeletePRList();
672  WriteInfo("Repo hard updated to " + originBranch.Tip.Sha, EventID.RepoHardUpdate);
673  return error;
674  }
675  res = MergeBranch(originBranch.FriendlyName, "Merge origin into current testmerge");
676  if (!LocalIsRemote()) //might be fast forward
677  PushTestmergeCommit();
678  if (res != null)
679  throw new Exception(res);
680  UpdateSubmodules();
681  WriteInfo("Repo merge updated to " + originBranch.Tip.Sha, EventID.RepoMergeUpdate);
682  return null;
683  }
684  catch (Exception E)
685  {
686  SendMessage("REPO: Update failed!", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
687  WriteWarning(String.Format("Repo{0} update failed", reset ? " hard" : ""), reset ? EventID.RepoHardUpdateFail : EventID.RepoMergeUpdateFail);
688  return E.ToString();
689  }
690  }
691  }

EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

void TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateSubmodules ( )
private

Properly updates any git submodules in the repository

697  {
698  var suo = new SubmoduleUpdateOptions
699  {
700  Init = true
701  };
702  foreach (var I in Repo.Submodules)
703  try
704  {
705  Repo.Submodules.Update(I.Name, suo);
706  }
707  catch (Exception e)
708  {
709  try
710  {
711  //workaround for https://github.com/libgit2/libgit2/issues/3820
712  //kill off the modules/ folder in .git and try again
713  try
714  {
715  Program.DeleteDirectory(String.Format("{0}/.git/modules/{1}", RepoPath, I.Path));
716  }
717  catch
718  {
719  throw e;
720  }
721  Repo.Submodules.Update(I.Name, suo);
722  var msg = String.Format("I had to reclone submodule {0}. If this is happening a lot find a better hack or fix https://github.com/libgit2/libgit2/issues/3820!", I.Name);
723  SendMessage(String.Format("REPO: {0}", msg), MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
724  WriteWarning(msg, EventID.Submodule);
725  }
726  catch (Exception ex)
727  {
728  WriteError(String.Format("Failed to update submodule {0}! Error: {1}", I.Name, ex.ToString()), EventID.Submodule);
729  }
730  }
731  }

bool TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateToVersion ( int  major,
int  minor 
)

updates the used byond version to that of version major .minor . The change won't take place until DD reboots. Calls ITGDreamDaemon.RequestRestart if blocked by a running DD instance. Runs asyncronously, use CurrentStatus to check progress

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGByond.

Definition at line 292 of file Byond.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.BusyCheck(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateToVersionImpl().

293  {
294  lock (ByondLock)
295  {
296  if (!BusyCheck())
297  {
298  updateStat = ByondStatus.Starting;
299  RevisionStaging = new Thread(new ParameterizedThreadStart(UpdateToVersionImpl))
300  {
301  IsBackground = true //don't slow me down
302  };
303  RevisionStaging.Start(String.Format("{0}.{1}", major, minor));
304  return true;
305  }
306  return false;
307  }
308  }

Here is the call graph for this function:

void TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateToVersionImpl ( object  param)

Downloads and unzips a BYOND revision. Calls ApplyStagedUpdate afterwards if the ServerInstance isn't running, otherwise, calls RequestRestart. Sets lastError on failure

Parameters
paramStringified BYOND revision

Definition at line 200 of file Byond.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.ApplyStagedUpdate(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.CleanByondStaging(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.DaemonStatus(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RequestRestart(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteError(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.UpdateToVersion().

201  {
202  lock (ByondLock) {
203  if (updateStat != ByondStatus.Starting)
204  return;
205  updateStat = ByondStatus.Downloading;
206  }
207 
208  try
209  {
210  CleanByondStaging();
211 
212  var vi = ((string)param).Split('.');
213  var major = Convert.ToInt32(vi[0]);
214  var minor = Convert.ToInt32(vi[1]);
215  var rrdp = RelativePath(RevisionDownloadPath);
216  using (var client = new WebClient())
217  {
218  SendMessage(String.Format("BYOND: Updating to version {0}.{1}...", major, minor), MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
219 
220  //DOWNLOADING
221 
222  try
223  {
224  client.DownloadFile(String.Format(ByondRevisionsURL, major, minor), rrdp);
225  }
226  catch
227  {
228  SendMessage("BYOND: Update download failed. Does the specified version exist?", MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
229  lastError = String.Format("Download of BYOND version {0}.{1} failed! Does it exist?", major, minor);
230  WriteWarning(String.Format("Failed to update BYOND to version {0}.{1}!", major, minor), EventID.BYONDUpdateFail);
231  lock (ByondLock)
232  {
233  updateStat = ByondStatus.Idle;
234  }
235  return;
236  }
237  }
238  lock (ByondLock)
239  {
240  updateStat = ByondStatus.Staging;
241  }
242 
243  //STAGING
244 
245  ZipFile.ExtractToDirectory(rrdp, RelativePath(StagingDirectory));
246  lock (ByondLock)
247  {
248  File.WriteAllText(RelativePath(StagingDirectoryInner + VersionFile), String.Format("{0}.{1}", major, minor));
249  //IMPORTANT: SET THE BYOND CONFIG TO NOT PROMPT FOR TRUSTED MODE REEE
250  Directory.CreateDirectory(RelativePath(ByondConfigDir));
251  File.WriteAllText(RelativePath(ByondDDConfig), ByondNoPromptTrustedMode);
252  }
253  File.Delete(RevisionDownloadPath);
254 
255  lock (ByondLock)
256  {
257  updateStat = ByondStatus.Staged;
258  }
259 
260  switch (DaemonStatus())
261  {
262  case DreamDaemonStatus.Offline:
263  if(ApplyStagedUpdate())
264  lastError = null;
265  else
266  lastError = "Failed to apply update!";
267  break;
268  default:
269  RequestRestart();
270  lastError = "Update staged. Awaiting server restart...";
271  SendMessage(String.Format("BYOND: Staging complete. Awaiting server restart...", major, minor), MessageType.DeveloperInfo);
272  WriteInfo(String.Format("BYOND update {0}.{1} staged", major, minor), EventID.BYONDUpdateStaged);
273  break;
274  }
275  }
276  catch (ThreadAbortException)
277  {
278  return;
279  }
280  catch (Exception e)
281  {
282  WriteError("Revision staging errror: " + e.ToString(), EventID.BYONDUpdateFail);
283  lock (ByondLock)
284  {
285  updateStat = ByondStatus.Idle;
286  lastError = e.ToString();
287  RevisionStaging = null;
288  }
289  }
290  }

void TGServerService.ServerInstance.Watchdog ( )
private

Threaded loop that keeps DreamDaemon from unintentionally stopping

Definition at line 304 of file DreamDaemon.cs.

References TGServerService.ServerInstance.Config, TGServerService.ServerInstance.currentPort, TGServerService.ServerInstance.MemTrackTimer_Elapsed(), TGServerService.IInstanceConfig.ReattachCommsKey, TGServerService.IInstanceConfig.ReattachPort, TGServerService.IInstanceConfig.ReattachProcessID, TGServerService.IInstanceConfig.ReattachRequired, TGServerService.ServerInstance.SCGracefulShutdown, TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendCommand(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.SendMessage(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.serviceCommsKey, TGServerService.ServerInstance.StartImpl(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteCurrentDDLog(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteError(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

Referenced by TGServerService.ServerInstance.InitDreamDaemon(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.StartImpl().

305  {
306  try
307  {
308  lock (restartLock)
309  {
310  if (!RestartInProgress)
311  {
312  SendMessage("DD: Server started, watchdog active...", MessageType.WatchdogInfo);
313  WriteInfo("Watchdog started", EventID.DDWatchdogStarted);
314  }
315  else
316  {
317  RestartInProgress = false;
318  if (!ReattachInsteadOfRestart)
319  WriteInfo("Watchdog restarted", EventID.DDWatchdogRestarted);
320  else
321  ReattachInsteadOfRestart = false;
322  }
323  }
324  var retries = 0;
325 
326  var MemTrackTimer = new System.Timers.Timer
327  {
328  AutoReset = true,
329  Interval = 5000 //every 5 seconds
330  };
331  MemTrackTimer.Elapsed += MemTrackTimer_Elapsed;
332  while (true)
333  {
334  var starttime = DateTime.Now;
335 
336  lock (watchdogLock)
337  {
338  if (AwaitingShutdown == ShutdownRequestPhase.Requested)
339  SendCommand(SCGracefulShutdown);
340  }
341 
342  //all good to go, let's start monitoring
343  var Now = DateTime.Now;
344  lock (watchdogLock)
345  {
346  CurrentDDLog = DateTime.UtcNow.ToString("yyyy-MM-ddTHH-mm-ssZ");
347  WriteCurrentDDLog("Starting monitoring...");
348  }
349  pcpu = new PerformanceCounter("Process", "% Processor Time", Proc.ProcessName, true);
350  MemTrackTimer.Start();
351  try
352  {
353  Proc.WaitForExit();
354  }
355  finally
356  {
357  lock (watchdogLock) //synchronize
358  {
359  MemTrackTimer.Stop();
360  pcpu.Dispose();
361  }
362  }
363 
364  WriteCurrentDDLog("Crash detected!");
365 
366  lock (watchdogLock)
367  {
368  currentStatus = DreamDaemonStatus.HardRebooting;
369  currentPort = 0;
370  Proc.Close();
371 
372  if (AwaitingShutdown == ShutdownRequestPhase.Pinged)
373  return;
374  var BadStart = (DateTime.Now - starttime).TotalSeconds < DDBadStartTime;
375  if (BadStart)
376  {
377  ++retries;
378  var sleep_time = (int)Math.Min(Math.Pow(2, retries), 3600); //max of one hour
379  SendMessage(String.Format("DD: Watchdog server startup failed! Retrying in {0} seconds...", sleep_time), MessageType.WatchdogInfo);
380  Thread.Sleep(sleep_time * 1000);
381  }
382  else
383  {
384  retries = 0;
385  var msg = "DD: DreamDaemon crashed! Watchdog rebooting DD...";
386  SendMessage(msg, MessageType.WatchdogInfo);
387  WriteWarning(msg, EventID.DDWatchdogRebootingServer);
388  }
389  }
390 
391  var res = StartImpl(true);
392  if (res != null)
393  throw new Exception("Hard restart failed: " + res);
394  }
395  }
396  catch (ThreadAbortException)
397  {
398  //No Mr bond, I expect you to die
399  try
400  {
401  if (!Config.ReattachRequired)
402  {
403  Proc.Kill();
404  Proc.WaitForExit();
405  }
406  else
407  {
408  Config.ReattachProcessID = Proc.Id;
409  Config.ReattachPort = currentPort;
410  Config.ReattachCommsKey = serviceCommsKey;
411  lock (restartLock)
412  {
413  RestartInProgress = true;
414  }
415  }
416  Proc.Close();
417  }
418  catch
419  { }
420  }
421  catch (Exception e)
422  {
423  SendMessage("DD: Watchdog thread crashed!", MessageType.WatchdogInfo);
424  WriteError("Watch dog thread crashed: " + e.ToString(), EventID.DDWatchdogCrash);
425  }
426  finally
427  {
428  lock (watchdogLock)
429  {
430  currentStatus = DreamDaemonStatus.Offline;
431  currentPort = 0;
432  AwaitingShutdown = ShutdownRequestPhase.None;
433  lock (restartLock)
434  {
435  if (!RestartInProgress)
436  {
437  if (!Config.ReattachRequired)
438  SendMessage("DD: Server stopped, watchdog exiting...", MessageType.WatchdogInfo);
439  WriteInfo("Watch dog exited", EventID.DDWatchdogExit);
440  }
441  else
442  WriteInfo("Watch dog restarting...", EventID.DDWatchdogRestart);
443  }
444  }
445  }
446  }

Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults

TGServerService.EventID
EventID
Various events and their IDs in no particular order. Found in the Windows event log. These key incremented by 100 and are guaranteed to never be reused in the future. In the windows event viewer, these IDs will be offset by the ServerInstance.LoggingID to distinguish events between instances. Each event ID may be information, a warning, or error and will be documented accordingly. Warnings will occur due to user, data, or network errors. Errors will occur due to filesystem errors or hard faults
Definition: EventID.cs:8

readonly byte LoggingID
Used to assign the instance to event IDs

string TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteText ( string  staticRelativePath,
string  data,
out bool  unauthorized 
)

Write to a static file

Implements TGServiceInterface.Components.ITGConfig.

Definition at line 104 of file Config.cs.

References TGServerService.Service.CancelImpersonation(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.RelativePath(), TGServerService.ServerInstance.StaticDirs, TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteInfo(), and TGServerService.ServerInstance.WriteWarning().

105  {
106  var path = RelativePath(StaticDirs) + '/' + staticRelativePath; //do not use path.combine or it will try and take the root
107  try
108  {
109  lock (configLock)
110  {
111  var di1 = new DirectoryInfo(RelativePath(StaticDirs));
112  var destdir = new FileInfo(path).Directory.FullName;
113  var di2 = new DirectoryInfo(destdir);
114 
115  var good = false;
116  while (di2 != null)
117  {
118  if (di2.FullName == di1.FullName)
119  {
120  good = true;
121  break;
122  }
123  else di2 = di2.Parent;
124  }
125 
126  if (!good)
127  {
128  unauthorized = false;
129  return "Cannot write above static directories!";
130  }
131 
132  Directory.CreateDirectory(destdir);
133  File.WriteAllText(path, data);
134  Service.CancelImpersonation();
135  WriteInfo("Write to " + path, EventID.StaticWrite);
136  unauthorized = false;
137  return null;
138  }
139  }
140  catch (UnauthorizedAccessException e)
141  {
142  //no need for the full stacktrace
143  unauthorized = true;
144  return e.Message;
145  }
146  catch (Exception e)
147  {
148  unauthorized = false;
149  Service.CancelImpersonation();
150  WriteWarning(String.Format("Write of {0} failed! Error: {1}", path, e.ToString()), EventID.StaticRead);
151  return e.ToString();
152  }
153  }

object configLock
Used for multithreading safety
